text:
So to clarify, the process for DR is

1. Take identity dump manually (Periodic dump would be sufficient (Maybe worth adding to the helm chart a cronjob to store the dump to pvc) )
2. Change helm values both for participant and validator-app (enabled migration: true)
Looking at the docs:
```There are three ways to recover from disasters:
In simple cases where only a single node is affected but the overall network is still healthy, a Restore from backup is usually sufficient.
If a full backup is unavailable but an identity backup has been created, the balance of the validator can be recovered on a new validator.
Lastly, for network-wide failures, a more complex Disaster recovery procedure is required.```
I have no backup, and no identity dump, meaning am i losing the data?
Can i take identity dump while my validator-app is down(Access to shell possible)? (Will be helpful to try to recover from that state)

elements.text: So to clarify, the process for DR is
Take identity dump manually (Periodic dump would be sufficient (Maybe worth adding to the helm chart a cronjob to store the dump to pvc) )
Change helm values both for participant and validator-app (enabled migration: true)
Looking at the docs:

There are three ways to recover from disasters:
In simple cases where only a single node is affected but the overall network is still healthy, a Restore from backup is usually sufficient.
If a full backup is unavailable but an identity backup has been created, the balance of the validator can be recovered on a new validator.
Lastly, for network-wide failures, a more complex Disaster recovery procedure is required.

I have no backup, and no identity dump, meaning am i losing the data?
Can i take identity dump while my validator-app is down(Access to shell possible)? (Will be helpful to try to recover from that state)

Hi! I am trying to setup a transfer pre-approval but I am getting stuck on submitting it:

{
      error: 'INVALID_PRESCRIBED_DOMAIN_ID(9,f632b38d): Cannot submit transaction to prescribed domain `global-domain::122071b3b1bd...` because: Some packages are not known to all informees on domain global-domain::122071b3b1bd...\n' +
        'Participant PAR::Orb-1-LP-1::1220ecfd542f... has not vetted 4646d50cbdec...\n' +
        'Participant PAR::Digital-Asset-Eng-4::122014c478f3... has not vetted 4646d50cbdec...\n' +
        'Participant PAR::Five-North-1::12203a8ebc9f... has not vetted 4646d50cbdec...\n' +
        'Participant PAR::Proof-Group-1::122051709d45... has not vetted 4646d50cbdec...\n' +
        'Participant PAR::SV...'
    }

I am not sure what this error means, does anyone have any idea of what I am doing wrong?
Thanks!

text:
Hello !
Studying our validator deployment and trying to prepare for the future. Is there any security issue to run mutliple validators or SV + validator on the same auth0 tenant ?

I just want to make sure of the possible auth0 needs in the future to best preview our subscription. I do not think this is an issue, but rather verify :wink: .

elements.text:

text:
I have the following problem:
- First I started the validator without the -a flag for authentication (about 1 week ago)
- Afterwards I tried to implement the authentication but was not successful. (start with -a flag)
(Probably because you have to delete all data)
- So I started it again without the -a flag and removed the whole configuration for the authentication (.env and nginx.conf) because I wanted to see the web UI ONCE first.

But now I get the following error at wallet.localhost:
Something went wrong. Latest error (24.3.2025, 16:26:54):
Error: Error when parsing config: { â€œissuesâ€: [ { â€œvalidationâ€: â€œurlâ€, â€œcodeâ€: â€œinvalid_stringâ€, â€œmessageâ€: â€œInvalid urlâ€, â€œpathâ€: [ â€œauthâ€, â€œtoken_audienceâ€ ] } ], â€œnameâ€: â€œZodErrorâ€ }.

Questions: How can I restore the original state without authentication?
If I completely reset everything, all data will be lost, right?
